newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds rise, all eyes on EU summit.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds rise, all eyes on EU summit.

text.p: Danish bond prices rose on Monday on a cautious market, awaiting news from a June 16-17 EU summit but generally optimistic that leaders would agree an EMU budget stability pact.
"Until we get announcements on the pact the market will be hesitant," a dealer said.

At 0745 GMT the benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 traded at 112.30, yielding 6.13 percent, up from Friday's 112.11. The seven percent 2007 bond, which becomes the benchmark on September 1, was up 0.11 point, at 104.96, yielding 6.32 percent.
The crown was virtually unchanged at 3.8066 to the mark.
The 2006 benchmark's 10-year yield gap with Germany widened to 48 basis points from Friday's 45 bp, with the 2007 gap to the bund increasing one point to 66 bp.
The 2006's June future was up 0.13 to 112.27 and the six percent mortgage bond due 2026 rose 0.25 to 90.60. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33-969650
